title: Quiz 1 - Boats And Stream
instruction: Direction (46-50): Study the following bar-graph and pie-chart carefully to answer the following questions.

quiz.text: A boat goes 14 km upstream in 42 minutes. The speed of stream is 4 km/h. The speed of boat in still water is
options: 24 km/h
25 km/h
30 km/h
23 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: The speed of a boat in still water is 7 km/h. If its speed in downstream is 10 km/h. Then the speed of stream is
options: 7 km/h
3 km/h
10 km/h
6 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: Aditya can row with stream at 10 km/h and against the stream at 6 km/h. His speed in still water is
options: 16 km/h
6 km/h
8 km/h
10 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: Speed of man is 12 km/h in still water. If the rate of current is 4 km/h, then the effective speed of the man upstream is
options: 6 km/h
7 km/h
5 km/h
8 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A man moves downstream at a rate of 14 km/h and upstream at a rate of 6 km/h. Speed of boat in still water is
options: 4 km/h
10 km/h
16 km/h
2 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A man moves 20 km downstream in 5 hours and 10 km up stream in same time. The speed of stream
options: 4 km/h
1 km/h
1.6 km/h
2 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A boat travels 18 km upstream in 6 hours. How long (In Hrs) will it take to cover the same distance downstream the speed current is one-fourth the speed of the boat in still water.
options: 3
4
3.6
3.4
None of these

quiz.text: A person can row with the stream at 8 km/h and against the stream at 4 km/h. The speed of the current is (In km/hr.)
options: 1
2
1.5
4
None of these

quiz.text: When the speed of a boat in still water is 4 km/h and the rate of stream is 2 km/h, find upstream speed of the boat?
options: 6 km/h
5 km/h
2 km/h
7 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: If the speed of a swimmer in still water is 9 km/h. Find the downstream speed of the swimmer, when the river is flowing with the speed of 6 km/h?
options: 15 km/h
18 km/h
3 km/h
12 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A swimmer’s speed in downstream is 11 km/h and speed of the stream is 1.5 km/h. Find the upstream speed of swimmer?
options: 8 km/h
9.5 km/h
9 km/h
6.25 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A boatman rows 1 km in 5 min along the stream and 6 km in 1 h against the stream. The speed of the stream is
options: 3 km/h
6 km/h
10 km/h
12 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: Keshav can row 60 km downstream and 36 km upstream, taking 10 h each time. What is the speed of the current?
options: 3 km/h
2.2 km/h
4 km/h
1.2 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: What time will be taken by a boat to cover a distance of 128 km along the stream, if speed of a boat in still water is 24 km/h and the speed of stream is 8 km/h?
options: 8 hr
4 hr
7 hr
6 hr
None of these

quiz.text: A man can row against the current three-fourth of a kilometer in 15 min and returns same distance in 10 min, then ratio of his speed to that of current is –
options: 3 : 5
5 : 3
1 : 5
5 : 1
None of these

quiz.text: A boat goes 48 km downstream in 20 h. It takes 4 h more to cover the same distance against the stream. What is the speed of the boat in still water?
options: 2.2 km/h
2 km/h
4 km/h
4.2 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A man can row 15 km downstream in 3 hours and 5 km upstream in 2.5 hours. His speed in still water in (km/hr.) is
options: 4 km/hr.
4.5 km/hr.
3.5 km/hr.
5 km/hr.
None of these

quiz.text: A man can row 44 km downstream in 4 hours. If the man’s rowing rate in still water is 8 km/hr, then find in what time will he cover 25 km upstream?
options: 5 hours
6 hours
4.5 hours
4 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A man can row 20 km/h in still water and the speed of the stream is 5 m/sec. Ratio of speed of man to current speed is
options: 9 : 10
4 : 1
1 : 4
10 : 9
None of these

quiz.text: A man can swim in still water at 9.6 km/hr but takes twice as long swim in upstream then in downstream. The speed of stream is
options: 3.2 km/hr
2.3 km/hr
5.6 km/hr
6.5 km/hr
None of these

quiz.text: The current of a stream runs at the rate of 4 km in an hour. A boat goes 6 km and comes back to the starting point in 2 h. The speed of the boat in still water is:
options: 6km/h
8km/h
7.5km/h
6.8km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A man can row 15 km/h downstream and 9 km/h upstream. The speed of the boat in still water is:
options: 8 km/h
10 km/h
15 km/h
12 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A boat running downstream covers a distance of 20 km in 2 h while it covers the same distance upstream in 5h. Then, speed of the boat in still water is :
options: 7 km/h
8 km/h
9 km/h
10 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: In a fixed time, a boy swims double the distance along the current that he swims against the current. If the speed of the current is 3 km/h, then find the rate of swimming in still water ?
options: 6 km/h
9 km/h
10 km/h
12 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A boat goes 20 km downstream in 1 h and the same distance upstream in 2h. The speed of the boat in still water is:
options: 15 km/h
10 km/h
5 km/h
7.5 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A man can row 30 km downstream and return in a total of 8 h. If the speed of the boat in still water is 4 times the speed of the current, then the speed of the current is:
options: 1 km/h
2 km/h
4 km/h
3 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A boatman rows 1 km in 10 min, along the stream and 3 km in 1 h against the stream. The speed of the stream is:
options: 1.5 km/h
6 km/h
10 km/h
12 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A man rows a boat 18 km in 4 h downstream and returns upstream in 12h. The speed of the stream (in km/h) is:
options: 1
1.5
2
2.5
None of these

quiz.text: A man can row at 5km/h in still water. If the velocity of current is 1 km/h and it takes him 1 h to row to a place and comes back, how far is the place?
options: 2.5 km
3 km
2.4 km
3.6 km
None of these

quiz.text: A man can swim at the rate of 4km/h in still water. If the speed of the water is 2km/h. Then, the time taken by him to swim 10 km upstream is :
options: 2.5 h
3.5 h
5 h
4 h
None of these

quiz.text: The speed of a boat along the stream is 12 km/h and against the stream is 8 km/h. The time taken by the boat to sail 24 km in still water is:
options: 2h
3h
2.4h
1.2h
None of these

quiz.text: Two boats A and B start towards each other from two places, 108 km apart. Speed of the boats A and B in still water are 12 km/h and 15 km/h, respectively. If A proceeds down and B up the stream, they will meet after:
options: 4.5h
4h
5.4h
6h
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio speed of a motorboat to the current of water is 36 : 5. The boat goes along with the current in 5h 10min. It will come back in:
options: 5h 50min
6h
6 h 50 min
12 h 10 min
None of these

quiz.text: A man swims downstream a distance of 15 km in 1h. If the speed of the current is 5 km/h, the time taken by the man to swim the same distance upstream is:
options: 1 h 30 min
45 min
2 h 30 min
3 h
None of these

quiz.text: Speed of a boat is 5 km/h in still water and the speed of the stream is 3 km/h. If the boat takes 3 h to go to a place and come back, the distance of the place is:
options: 3.75 km
4 km
4.8 km
4.25 km
None of these

quiz.text:
A man who swim 48m/minute in still water, swims 200m against the current and 200m with the current. The difference between the time taken by him against the stream and with the stream is 10 minutes.

Quantity 1: speed of current.

Quantity 2: Speed of a man who completes 3 rounds of a circular path of radius 49 m in 14 minutes.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Speed of current is  less then the speed of a boat in still water. If the difference between distance covered by boat in 2 hour upstream and  hour downstream is 16 km, then

Quantity I  Upstream speed.

Quantity II  Original speed of the car which when troves a distance of 110 km develops a problem in the engine and proceeds at  th of its original speed and arrives at the distortion 60 minutes late. Had the problem developed 30 km further on, the car would have arrived 12 minutes sooner.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
A motor-boat, travelling at the same speed, can cover 20 Km upstream and 36 Km downstream in 8 hours.

Qunatity1: speed of boat.

Qunatity2: speed of stream
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2 or No Relation can be established.

quiz.text:
Qunatity1: ‘x’ -  A man rows 6km/h in still water. If the river is running at 3km/h, it takes him 45 minutes to row to a place and back. The distance is

Qunatity2: ‘y’- A man can row at 5km/h in still water. If the river is running at 1km/h, it takes him 75 minutes to row to a place and back. The distance is
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2 or No Relation can be established.

quiz.text:
Qunatity1- ‘x’- A boat went down the river for a distance of 20 km. It then turned back and returned to its starting point, having travelled a total of 7 hours. On its return trip, at a distance of 12 km from the starting point it encountered a log which had passed the starting point at the moment at which the boat had started downstream. The downstream speed of the boat is

Qunatiy2- ‘y’- Two boats go downstream from point X to point Y. The faster boat covers the distance from X to Y 1.5 times as fast as the slower boat. It is known that for every hour the slower boat lags behind the faster boat by 8 km. However if they go upstream then the faster boat covers the distance from Y to X in half the time as the slower boat. The speed of the slower boat in still water is y km/hr.
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2 or No Relation can be established.

quiz.text: If the person visited Meena Bazar and Secretariat on Monday and Wednesday respectively, the time he takes to  cross the river both ways on Wednesday is how many times the time he  takes to cross the river on return  journey on  Monday ?
options: 12
6
9
13
15

quiz.text: What is the difference between the total time taken by the person while visiting and returning from Bara Imambara on Monday and visiting the Janeshwar Park on Friday? (Land Area covered by Bus @ 40 kmph)
options: 40.635
45.525
43.625
33.725
None of the above

quiz.text: On which day, variation in speed of boat is maximum as compared to previous day?
options: Tuesday
Wednesday
Friday
Saturday
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the ratio of time spent on boat while going to Secretariat and Meena Bazar?
options: 19:31
11:25
11:27
27:10
Cannot be determined

quiz.text: Distance covered on land while going to Janeshwar Park is what percent of distance covered on land while going to Secretariat?
options: 8%
10%
16%
13%
Can’t be determined

quiz.text: If boat A from point X travels 240 km to reach a point Y. When Boat A has reached at point Y then boat D started from the point X and moved towards point Y and at the same time boat A started moving towards point X. then Find the distance from point X where they meet with other ? (direction of stream is from point Y to point X)
options: 35 km
32 km
25 km
28 km
30 km

quiz.text: What is the total time that will take to cover given distance of 1000 km against the stream ?
options: 10 days & 5 hrs.
9 days & 4 hrs.
11 days & 5 hrs.
Can’t be determined
None of these

quiz.text: If the speed of boat C is increased by 40% and the speed of stream decreases by 20% then what is the difference between the time taken by the boat now and that taken previously to travel 200 km? (Assume opposite direction of stream)
options: 28  hours
22  hours
20  hours
18  hours
35  hours

quiz.text: If the speed of boat D increases by 10% then what is the approximate time taken by Shyam to reach 500 km by boat D? (Assume opposite direction of stream)
options: 88 hours
92.6 hours
68 hours
78 hours
44 hours

quiz.text: What is the ratio of the time taken by boat C to that taken by boat D to travel equal distance? (Assume same direction of stream)
options: 9:7
7:5
5:3
7:3
3: 2
